title: Pityriasis Rubra Pilaris: Etiology and Pathogenesis
short_description: Clinical document discussing the unknown underlying causes of Pityriasis Rubra Pilaris (PRP) and the role of genetic, environmental, and other factors.
long_description: This clinical research document examines the etiology of Pityriasis Rubra Pilaris (PRP), a rare dermatological condition. The document discusses current understanding that the specific underlying cause remains unknown, while highlighting the believed involvement of genetic predisposition, environmental triggers, and other unidentified factors in disease development. It also addresses the historical theory linking vitamin A deficiency to PRP, noting that this connection lacks sufficient evidence and that vitamin A treatment has shown limited effectiveness in managing the condition.
